meanings.definition: To make or convert into a robot.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys robotising old toys to give them new life.
meanings.sent2: The factory is robotising its assembly line to increase efficiency.
meanings.sent3: After robotising her alarm clock, it now wakes her up with a dance.
meanings.sent4: His creativity robotised the mundane office environment into a colorful wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The magician robotised a deck of cards, making them move on their own.

meanings.definition: To automate or mechanize a process or task.
meanings.sent1: The company is robotising their customer service with chatbots.
meanings.sent2: By robotising the packaging process, they saved time and reduced errors.
meanings.sent3: The chef robotised the pancake flipping, impressing the customers.
meanings.sent4: His mind robotised the steps of the dance, making his performance flawless.
meanings.sent5: The inventor robotised the watering system, ensuring the plants were always hydrated.
